snippet: More and more Jews say the time to free Jonathan J. Pollard is long past, but they are unsure whether he should be used as a chit in a diplomatic transaction with Israel.
abstract: More and more Jews say the time to free Israeli spy Jonathan J Pollard is long past, but they are deeply divided over whether he should be used as a chit in a diplomatic transaction with Israel; for an older generation, potential release rouses another unwelcome ghost from past: suggestion that American Jews inevitably hold divided loyalties and cannot be trusted in sensitive posts.
lead_paragraph: More and more Jews say the time to free Jonathan J. Pollard is long past, but they are unsure whether he should be used as a chit in a diplomatic transaction with Israel.

headline.main: Talk of Freeing a Spy for Israel Stirs Old Unease for U.S. Jews
headline.print_headline: Talk of Freeing a Spy for Israel Stirs Old Unease for U.S. Jews
